Reviews.Title: “Review of the Spa Only”
Reviews.Author: angela w
Reviews.Content: Recently had a massage and a body scrub here. Both were excellent! Pauline, my masseuse took care to really work out all my knots. She was really great about customizing my experience. They have a pool, hot tub and lounge chairs which I was able to use as well. It was a lovely afternoon! Minus one star due to the lack of locker room/showers. I guess most people using the spa are staying at the hotel, so it probably doesn't bother most guests.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate setting, excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: WalkaboutTigger
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property nearly every month for the last 18 months and have been in each and every room. The owners, Bill and Joanne, are friendly and helpful, the rooms are immaculate and the price is consistently better than the other properties in the area. It is conveniently located on a quiet street 2 blocks from Hwy 29. It has ample parking. There are restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. Each room has a deep whirlpool bath and separate shower. Your spa robes are hanging in the closet and the in-room coffee is actually quite good. The continental breakfast is more of a traditional Sunday Brunch with crescents, pastries, hot and cold cereal, fresh fruit and hot entrees. I enjoyed this hotel and spa enough as a business traveler that I am booking nights here when I take wine tasting tours with my family.

Reviews.Title: “For a motel off main street it has all the amenities incl. fireplace in the room.”
Reviews.Author: mcksgonsior
Reviews.Content: Same as above - fine for motel off Lincoln (Main) Street, Calistoga, Ca

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Juls082
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here in march and it was great! We had a king room (room 8) which had a cute little fireplace and a gigantic tub (which was a bit awkward to get into, bit totally worth it!). I think this was the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in, we didn't hear one noise from our neighbors. Breakfast in the morning was nice by the fireplace outside (perfect for a chilly morning). Walking distance to many restaurants downtown Calistoga (though there is not much else there). Quick drive to winieries. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt want to stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Yenkocrew
Reviews.Content: We came up to calistoga from merced for the World of Outlaws weekend. Unfortunately due to bad weather it was canceled, so we made the best of our stay. Normal check-in closes at 10pm and we got in at 3am. The front desk was able to provide a way in after hours to accomidate our late arrival. The rooms are cozy and the fireplaces heat the rooms really well. Make sure if you stay that you don't miss breakfast. Simple and a comfortable feeling with daily baked pasteries and fresh cooked goodies. Bill has an awsome knowledge of local good eats and things to do even if it poring outside. Will be back for the postponed calistoga race!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: mangiam0
Reviews.Content: It's not hard to find lodging in the Wine Country that offers charm, amenities, peace, quiet, and clean/spacious accommodations. Finding such a place that doesn't cost as much as the GNP of a small nation is a bit trickier! The EuroSpa & Inn is perfect - not pretentious or fancy but very clean, spacious and comfortable (great bed!) the rooms are equipped with a fireplace, microwave, fridge, jacuzzi, free WiFi. After a tasty breakfast (Bill's granola is delish) we strolled to downtown Calistoga, just a block away. Thumbs way up - this is a sweet little inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little inn”
Reviews.Author: H M
Reviews.Content: At first glance EuroSpa & Inn looked like an average motel, what with the distribution of rooms looking out onto the parking lot. However, once I entered my room I was delightfully pleased by the cozy decor, the little fireplace, the convenient kitchenette, and the spacious bathroom equipped with a jacuzzi for two. The bathroom amenities were classy and high quality, and the bed and linens were cozy in our room. The spa prices were also surprisingly affordable, as was the price of our room. And I liked the nice detail of cookies and apple cider left out for the guests in the afternoon, and the sensible, yet quality breakfast assortment, which even included hard boiled eggs, which isn't usually common in "continental breakfast" assortments at other similarly-priced places. Now the downsides. The TV set in the room was old and the color looked ugly (and the remote control only allowed for switching channels and navigating Comcast, not brightness settings, etc.) I also felt the outdoor pool and jacuzzi left something to be desired. Considering the area and its proliferation of natural hot springs, it would have been nice to have had access to a natural mineral pool, not just a tiny little chlorinated jacuzzi. Also, Wi-Fi signal in our room was barely there, and we were not able to connect to the Internet at all through it, neither on my laptop or Nook. This was a big downside, since my husband had to get in touch with his work colleagues and was not able to. On a personal note, I was also a little personally miffed that at checkout time the desk clerk, seemed to have assumed that I was a cleaning lady (perhaps because I have dark hair and look very Hispanic???) and she was a little off-putting when I initially engaged with her, asking me if I had already spoken to some other Hispanic-named woman (an employee, I am guessing?). Since there were other customers at the front desk at the same time, she approached me as if whisking me off so that they wouldn't see me. Only then did I say, "umm, I'm here to check out???" I was a little offended by that encounter, but oh well, maybe I do look like someone who works there! Aside from that though, nice place, nice spa, nice massages, cozy rooms, and affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property in a Beautiful Town”
Reviews.Author: phil1985
Reviews.Content: I booked one night in the EuroSpa for a work trip in February of 2012 and I was very pleased with the experience. First, the staff could not be more courteous and accommodating, they are definitely there to make sure you feel at home. The hotel is off the beaten path slightly, but is still walking distance from the downtown/main street area and tons of restaurants and wineries. There is also a fantastic view of vineyards in the back side of the hotel at the pool and spa, very secluded and very beautiful. I would recommend this hotel 100% to any future guests of Calistoga, also the price for these rooms is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lenora d
Reviews.Content: Looking for a rejuvenating relaxing getaway? Make sure to put EuroSpa & Inn at the top of your list! We were met by the resident Managers Bill and Joanne Clazimer. They provided us with the information on the amenities. Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. We spent a lot of time in the hot tub and pool. Each morning we had a complimentary nutritious breakfast and refreshments in the evening, all free! Thanks Joanne for arranging everything to nicely! We will come back again. Kudos to Linda and Brian for the spa treatments, simple fantastic! Our rating? We give it a 10 easily! The Days

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but needs new mattresses”
Reviews.Author: Glasphoto
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. we just had a problem with the mattress. It really wasn't very comfortable. morning breakfast was great sand although we missed the afternoon food I heard it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great little motel just out of downtown Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: havewinewilltravel
Reviews.Content: We like to go to Calistoga for a quick 1-2 night getaway because it is close and laid back. We have a couple of places that we enjoy over there but found a great deal on EuroSpa and thought we would give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised. We were greeted by a very friendly young man who told us about the property, our room, breakfast, tea, the hot tub, spa, etc. He was very helpful and so refreshingly nice! There were fresh, warm cookies, coffee and tea available at night as well. The room was nice, well sized and had efficient amenities. The little gas fireplace made the room very cozy. We also liked the small kitchen space with sink, refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was clean and practical. Nothing fancy but the bathtub was deep enough to soak. In the morning they had a nice layout or fresh fruit, hard-boiled eggs, rolls, bread and croissants. There was great hot coffee and a nice assortment of teas. The fireplace in the outdoor breakfast area was also going and made the winter morning very pleasant and enjoyable. The only complaint I had was that the pool was not heated nearly warm enough to get into on a cool winter evening. That is one of the joys of Calistoga hot spring hotels is that you can float around and soak in a nice warm swimming pool...that was a bit disappointing. The hot tub was hot but the surface was very rough and scratchy. It was rough enough to snag your swimming suit so beware of that if you have a nice, delicate suit and do not want it to get ruined on a rough surface. The motel is within easy walking distance to all restaurants and shops in downtown Calistoga. Overall a great experience! We will be back but probably only during summer months when the cooler pool might be more refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “It's just hard to get MOTEL out of your head”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2k
Reviews.Content: This is a motel. The scenery is paved parking lot. And this is reflected in the price of a room. But everything else was excellent. Room was small, but well appointed. We had one with a two person jacuzzi and fireplace. Both worked well wtihout any issues. We had the mud wrap and couples massage. Both fantastic and well worth it. Breakfast outside under the heater was fresh, delicious, and plentiful. I recommend....but it's still a MOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: romaniangirlamerican
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we felt at home. The place is comfortable and relaxed. Very clean, wonderful bedding! This was beyond our expectations! friendly and great without a high price! The breakfast and snacks are outstanding! Poached eggs in a nest with mushroom garnish, what can I say after eating 3 of them, delicious!!! The cookies in the afternoon are a treat! These people are top hosts in my book, friendly and generous! Made my son's wedding special! We will be back! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “For a very relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: We love EuroSpa and Inn in Calistoga! It's a charming place, very comfortable with a big jetted tub in the bathroom, a cute little "stove" for heat in the bedroom, and a great "hot tub" and pool out back. It is also just a few short blocks to the center of town. The beds are king size and super comfy and all around, it is a quiet and relaxing place to stay. We haven't taken advantage of the spa yet as we're always so relaxed from just being there. They have marvelous weekday specials too - a great value. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, relaxing, and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the EuroSpa and Inn a few times over the last few years and I am a big fan. Over the holidays a few family members and I booked rooms here for a mini-getaway and it was just as great as I remember it from a few years ago. First of all, I grew up in the Napa Valley so I know Calistoga pretty well. I also know how expensive hotels can be (all over the valley, not just Calistoga!). I feel like you can't really beat the EuroSpa and Inn price-wise, especially for what you get. The location: fantastic, just a block or so off the main drag. It's quiet and feels remote, although you are a quick walk away from restaurants and spas. Ambiance: EuroSpa feels kind of like a retro motor-lodge to me...small, you can park right up by your room, but it's very cute and quaint. The rooms are cozy...HUGE WHIRLPOOL TUBS are seriously amazing, and you get a fireplace in your room! If you are expecting fancy or super modern, this is not it. If you like cozy and little rustic, you've come to the right place! Service: the people who work here are really friendly and nice. The included morning breakfast is fantastic; you MUST try the house-made granola! Coffee, fruit, bagels, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, etc. etc. all provided as well. In the afternoons they have little nibbles like cookies along with apple cider...very cute! The "breakfast" area is a cute outdoor patio with a nice firepit...or, if you are antisocial you can take a tray back to your room! Things I Can't Personally Vouch For: spa and pool. I've always come for quick winter trips so I haven't had a chance to try out their pool or indulge at their spa, but they both look good to me. Why I Gave them 4 Stars and not 5: no mineral pools! Lots of other hotels in the area offer mineral pools, but EuroSpa doesn't have one. It's not a huge deal, as you can easily visit neighboring hotels and spas and get a mineral pool daypass, but it would be nice to have one at EuroSpa as well. I hope to come back to EuroSpa for many years to come! I've already recommended it to many family members and friends (one couple I know came here for their anniversary and loved it!).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LisenGBG
Reviews.Content: Loved it! I had no high expectations before coming here. Thought it would be like a motel almost. But that was so wrong. We stayed one night in the suite, and it was fabulous. The beds are huge and confortable, it´s clean and cosy. The bathroom is even bigger. The staff is friendly and helpful. It´s only a few minute walk to the main street of Calistoga. I can really recommend this lovely hotel. I wish i could have stayed much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town!”
Reviews.Author: chelsjc
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place! My best friend and I booked it for a girls spa weekend after having stayed at a number of other places during previous trips here over the years. Have to say we were pleasantly surprised by it. The room was huge with a spa tub and a shower. It offers continental breakfast and late afternoon snacks on its patio. The owners/managers are more than happy to offer recommendations for meals, shopping and sp services. Additionally, it has it's own spa services on site. After a less than stellar experience at a well known spa in town ... The spa here was able to provide a good massage and a relaxing environment. We will so stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are visiting Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: DinaPG
Reviews.Content: We decided to make reservations at Euro Spa after reading a couple reviews; it was our first time at Napa Valley, we decided to stay in Calistoga and visit Napa and Sonoma, distance is ok. Steve at the reception was great and gave us some flyers and discounts for restaurants and wineries. Euro Spa&Inn has 14 rooms i think, so its not huge, its very quiet and relaxing, 2 minutes walking distance to Calistoga downtown so you can enjoy a good dinner and drinks, also has stores for gifts and a couple of places for wine tasting. FYI loved the store where they have soap and lotions made in Napa! The room is very clean, the bed and pillows are awesome, super comfortable; we loved the hot bath tub for 2. The room has microwave and a little fridge in case you want to snack something in the room. We ended up not using the outside heated pool and Jacuzzi because it was a bit cold at night. The breakfast was good, i as expecting some more variety of pastries tho, but everything was fresh. On our last day there we reserved a couples massage, 1 hour we paid $159 for 2, was very good, relaxing and very professional. We visited Castello di Amorosa winery, such a great surprise over there, we loved the place and the wine tasting, we paid $32 for 2, we used the flyer 2 for 1 that Steve gave us at the reception at Euro Spa, it was a good deal! Very close to the hotel. Its a good location to visit Calistoga, St Helena, Napa and Sonoma, good prize for the room its close to everything. I recommend Euro Sp& Inn for sure, its relaxing, calm, quiet, comfortable, we had a great weekend there, hope we can come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Motel is more like it”
Reviews.Author: ggirl04
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay here on a recommendation from a friend. The location itself is beautiful and the town is very quaint, if only the rooms were updated it would have been the perfect place to stay. I did not travel from the East coast to stay in a motel with a squeaky mattress and beat up oak furniture, not to mention the dated decor! The breakfast on the outdoor patio was extremely nice, however, as the atmosphere is what this place has going for it. We only stayed one night because we got in after midnight. The next morning we checked out and stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth visit and more charming than ever.”
Reviews.Author: ESJT
Reviews.Content: Joanne and Bill are charming hosts, This was our fourth visit and the EuroSpa is becoming our location of choice in the Napa Valley. The Inn is convenient to many locations, the coast, the wineries, the mountains. The town of Calistoga is a very easy walk. But most of all the welcoming atmosphere you feel when you arrive and while you are there. Joann and Bill make it happen, We are already looking forward to a return in 2012

Reviews.Title: “the spa at eurospa”
Reviews.Author: debbiebeidleman
Reviews.Content: My S. CA friend and I just returned from two nights at the Eurospa Inn in Calistoga,CA. The accomodations were great, but the spa was the best! I lucked out and got the owner, Dylan, for a 1-1/2 hour deep tissue massage. He was, without question, the best massage therapist I have ever had, and there have been many!>>> If you are passing through Calistoga, don't miss the massage of your life with Dylan. You may as well stay right there at the Eurospa Inn where you will have a lovely room, great breakfast, friendly managers, jacuzzi, nicely kept grounds...all a short walk to town and at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Would be fine for half the price”
Reviews.Content: We chose EuroSpa for the price, location, and the fact that we didn't have to put down a deposit. The location is fine, an easy walk to the main drag, but quietly off the main drag. The room was disappointing in that the furniture is old and the mattress was pretty uncomfortable. Nice linens, clean bathroom. The continental breakfast was better than average. Bottom line, is if we are going to spend over $200 per night, we expect a much nicer place. Next time we'll pay a little extra and stay at a higher end hotel where you get what you pay for, or we'll stay out of town where the rates are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh... don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Renery
Reviews.Content: I'm inclined to keep this secret to myself, but I'll share with my tripadvisor friends! EuroSpa & Inn is one of the only inns in Calistoga where you can stay for one night on the weekend. Every other nice place requires a 2 night stay on weekends. If you're familiar with Calistoga, this place used to be called Pine St. Inn. It has been upgraded since those days. It's like an old-style single story motel with parking in front of your room and a porch separating the rooms from the parking area. Our room had a small kitchenette & table. Very comfortable bed & pillows. Easy walk to town. Nice pool & hot tub. Didn't take advantage of the 2 for 1 massages, but I'll tell you it was a steal! Delicious breakfast with quiche, cereals, good coffee, juices. Friendly owners. Here's a tip: call the hotel directly for a reservation. We paid $229 for a night via a booking service, and the owner said it we had called direct we could have gotten a much better rate.

Reviews.Title: “A True Jem in the Heart of Wine Country!”
Reviews.Author: rermiami
Reviews.Content: They say that the Napa area in California is as close to heaven as you can get, the EuroSpa takes you a step closer. The owners, Bill and Joann, are one of the best host you can ask for. They take pride in making sure your stay is as wonderful as it can get. The morning breakfast prepared by Bill is always a culinary delight, the only way one can truly start their day. The EuroSpa is off the main street in town and because of this it is a quiet and relaxing place to stay. The rooms are quaint with a touch of country ambience and have a peaceful feeling when you return from the day of wine tasting. The pool and hot tub are a wonderful way to unwind. When you visit, ask Bill to give you some insider tips on where to go. I highly recommend this place if you ever visit Calistoga!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Humphrey W
Reviews.Content: A great place to unwind and take in the beauty of Calistoga - the rooms were very comfortable and the bathrooms were well kitted out with a great bath and separate shower. The breakfast was not as good, but really if you are looking for a place to stay I wouldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing and quaint place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DanerFrawley
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast! Extremely affordable! Quaint and extremely clean! Cute and private front porches to enjoy a bottle of wine from your favorite vineyard that day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly innkeepers”
Reviews.Author: tneumer
Reviews.Content: Large room with a 2 person jacuzzi tub, great amentities and lovely area for breakfast outside with the mountains in view! Don't worry if it is cool as there is a fireplace to keep you warm!The hottub and pool also have the beautiful view and are next to an organic farmers tomato fields and vineyards. While dining out at local restuarants we actually ate the farmers tomatoes in a wonderful salad. Ask Bill and Joann all about them. Bill is a retired chef and makes his own fresh granola and homemade bakery each morning along with fruit and eggs. The snacks in the afternoon when I was there were fresh cookies, cheese, sausage, crackers and sparkling cider. We had a couples massage the day we got there to unwind and prepare us for 5 days of relaxation and winetasting. Our masseuses were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all that is written”
Reviews.Author: Tonygearuk
Reviews.Content: All in all a comfortable lodge type place. Large room clean bathroom and good amineties. Breakfast acceptable but definitely not gourmet as stated, afternoon snacks consisted of a plate of cookies and alcohol free cider. AC unit so old and noisey. But in convienient downtown location and Bill is friendly if somewhat blinded by his importance.

Reviews.Title: “I am floored by all of the 4 and 5 star ratings.”
Reviews.Author: vamel
Reviews.Content: This motor lodge is at most a 3 star, more likely a 2.5 star place. The most positive thing about it was the breakfast, but you can get a good breakfast anywhere. The price was reasonable, but next time for the same price I will stay in Santa Rosa at a Hilton or Hyatt brand hotel and then I will know what I am getting. It is situated on a residential street with no street lighting. The rooms are just ok, the bed creaked, but was otherwise comfortable. I tried this hotel based on the reviews and was disappointed. I have stayed at B&Bs that were welcome surprises and hoped that this would be the same. However, it was not. The best way I can describe it is that it is a motor lodge, with updated bathrooms. That's it, not quaint, not a gem and not a pleasant surprise. The staff was fine, but did not engage us in any manner, which is unlike my experience with good innkeepers. I like to try new places and am generally happy anywhere from Hampton Inns to 4 star hotels. I will not stay here again nor would I recommend this place to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: PhilNI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while staying in Calistoga. Wonderful little hotel close to the main street and walking distance to restaurants. Our room was very clean and well-equipped with a very comfy bed. Nice little pool area. Lovely fresh breakfast served in an outdoor breakfast area which we really liked. One of the nicest places we stayed in our 3 weeks in CA. Would recommend doing the "Cool Wine Tour" from the bike shop which is just around the corner for a fun day out. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Like stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: capekathybrewster
Reviews.Content: Eurospa was a perfect place to stay. It reminded us of staying with our parents on vacation back in the fifties, and that's not a bad thing. It was perfect for exploring many wineries and being able to walk downtown to restaurants and shops. Our room was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was huge! Breakfasts were set up under the covered porch and a wine tasting was provided there one afternoon which was a lot of fun. We lounged by the pool and even took advantage of our little porch to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening. My husband and I so enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rich A
Reviews.Content: What a charming place. We spent a week touring the Napa and Sonoma valleys, and as beautiful as the area is, we loved coming back to the Europsa each afternoon and lounging in the shade by the pool and hot tub. Helpful staff, lovely fresh fruit at breakfast, and a charming room with a huge bathroom. Much more fun than big hotel, and much less expensive. Try to get unit 6, it's like a small 1BR house all your own. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: hccpsu
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the EuroSpa and Inn during our stay in the Napa Valley, and would stay there again. It's a block off the main street, so it's quiet yet convenient. The rooms are a little dated, but large and clean. The rooms have a fridge and microwave, which was very nice! The bathrooms had the nice touch of having Q-tips, cotton rounds and cotton balls (there's a hair dryer in the closet, along with robes). Breakfast was great--a nice selection of items each day, and as a tea drinker, I appreciated all the different varieties they stock, and my husband said the coffee is very good. Afternoon snacks are also provided, which we enjoyed, and there's always fresh fruit available, which is another perk you usually don't find elsewhere. We also used the pool and hot tub. All in all, we were very happy with our choice, especially for the price, and we'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint out of the way but fun motel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMamaGoose
Reviews.Content: We were unable to find a room in Calistago, California (northern end of the Napa Valley), so in despiration we found the Euro Spa and Inn --- only 13 rooms nestled in the trees on a side street. What a nice surprise! Large rooms, refrigerator, microwave, all the amenities except a hairdryer, and a king-size comfortable bed at a reasonable price. The outdoor pool was lovely, but the real surprise came at breakfast which was served on the outdoor patio. Home- made scones and sweet rolls with home-made granola and egg/bacon cups. The coffee and juice was outstanding, and the owners delightful. Definitely good for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and price in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Yipee43
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Sunday and Monday during Labor Day weekend and thought it was perfect for what we needed. My boyfriend and I stayed in the Standard Queen room, which was'nt enormous, but completely fine for the two of us. The fridge was great for chilling wine or bringing home leftovers. After a long day of wine tasting, the pool, hot tub, pizza snacks and cookies were exactly what we needed. My mom and brother shared the 2 bedroom suite, which had a gigantic bathroom and gave them plenty of space and privacy. We liked that the alarm clock had an ipod player built in so we could open our window, sit outside and listen to music. Calistoga is a cute rustic vibe town and we loved how it has a more laid back feel than other parts of Napa Valley. The Calistoga Inn bar is only a block away and was a great place for drinks and dancing after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “This place is like a bed and breakfast only with more privacy and seperate accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: MsAMuseBouche
Reviews.Content: It is like a little one level hotel in a horseshoe shape with everything completely rennovated! The people are nice and they have an outside areas for a continental breakfast everyday. Coffee pots in the room along with great coffee stocked. They make you feel right at home and the lovely porches are great to sit on for a romantic stay in dinner and relaxation. So far the best place we have stayed in Calistoga and we will recommend to family and friends! The price was very good, if you book ahead! Thanks Eurospa! Oh the facial was awesome! Walking distance from town! Be sure to go to Yountsville and eat at Bottega and go to Vsattui winery, Rubicon and Mondavi winery's!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: kathg
Reviews.Content: Great bath, great outside facilities and good rooms for the price. We were very happy staying here. The hotel was in a great location for the town and offered a number of health services which we didnt use. Breakfast outside in the winter next to an open fire was a lovely touch and the spa bath in the room was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: suzbaglady
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem, walking distance from downtown Calistoga. Eleven rooms, mine was very clean and cozy. Quiet location. Breakfast was perfect: coffee, granola, pastries, yogurt and fruit. The owners Bill and Joanne are on site and more than willing to help in any way. I never made it in time but I know they have cookies and beverages in the afternoon. There is small refrigerator and a microwave in the room. There is a spa on site, I did not have time to try it. I had a difficult time connecting to WiFi in my room. I saw some people using their laptops outside. I look forward to staying there again in October.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to get back to Calistoga and the EuroSpa & Inn!”
Reviews.Author: SPRSTR5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the EuroSpa and Inn in Calistoga from July 19-22 2011. Initially we had shied away from staying so "far away" from the rest of Napa but were pleasantly surprised to find that everything was alot closer than expected. The Inn is small and very cosy, with only a few rooms, which was perfect for us as we needed the short break before heading back to Singapore for work. The staff were all very helpful and the room was clean and well decorated. There are rooms with queen beds that are a little smaller and then there are rooms with king beds and a fireplace, which we would have liked to have had, but they were all reserved. EuroSpa & Inn was walking distance into Calistoga so there was no issue with finding great eateries in the evenings. The temperatures soared during our stay and we enjoyed the pool and outdoor jaccuzi every day and evening. I could not recommend a better place to stay in Napa that offers the best value for money. Great place and we will definately be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was good...but room not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: SiliconValleyCA
Reviews.Content: Nice little motor Inn but not worth over 200 a night even in Napa Valley. Wish I had a do over...not enough parking, old furniture, sketchy neighborhood.....but it will do if there is nothing else available....you can do better...

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dreary room that smelled really bad..disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: unbaised4u2
Reviews.Content: I booked this room based on the reviews and photos.....completely different than what I expected. The room was so dark with one window that looked out to a fence about 2 ft from the window. Ok so that I coulees deal with but the room smelled foul...like sewage or mildew. Thankfully it was only one night or I would have high tailed it out of there fast. The room was clean but old. The only true thing was the breakfast...it was good but not good enough to overlook all the other negatives. The price I paid was way out of line for what I received. The owners were not overly friendly but not rude either...just average. I can't understand the glowing reviews...TrioAdvisor let me down this time!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDuo
Reviews.Content: When we were planning our visit to Napa, we had lots of choices to book from, but we were so glad to have chosen EuroSpa. We totally loved our stay at this place and wouldn't be staying anywhere else if we are visiting Napa. We specfically liked the location of this place - a little off beat from the hustle and bustle, yet so close to the wineries. There were lots of packages to choose from and we could even customize our own package - free wine tasting coupons (lots of them), a three course dinner at local joint (the food was excellent), couple's massage and the highlight of it all was the early balloon ride in Napa valley - all of this at a very reasonable price. The place also had a very cozy outdoor pool and it wasn't crowded! We had the pool all by ourselves in the morning when the temperature outside was in the 80s and totally loved it. Our room had a very comfortable king bed and a two person jacuzzi tub. To top it all, the owner Bill Clazmer and his wife were excellent hosts. We missed their home cooked goodies and amazing breakfast for our balloon ride where breakfast is provided, but this is something you wouldn't want to miss. All in all, I would highly recommend the place for a romantic weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Danes1221
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Short walk to town. Nice continental breakfast. Great staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lovejones69
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for his Birthday. Best choice ever. Staff was friendly and very welcoming. Wine tasting at the Eurospa was a nice touch. Looking forward to spending my Birthday here as well!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little place”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoSue
Reviews.Content: We came to Eurospa and Inn to celebrate my husband's 65th birthday. The Inn is a remodled auto court with just a few units. Although it is rather quaint, it was perfect for our romantic get away. The decor is not fancy, but the surroundings are quiet and lovely. We walked 4 blocks to town for dinner the first night. The continental breakfast included fresh cut-up fruit and wonderful homemade granola along with a selection of toasts and pastries. We both had massages, relaxed in the pool and went wine tasting. Overall, we throughly enjoyed our extended weekend in Calistoga at EuroSpa and Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Best little jewel in wine country!”
Reviews.Author: DianeSail
Reviews.Content: EuroSpa & Inn is a wonderful small retreat away from home. My husband and I were welcomed to a quiet relaxing room with birds singing and flowers blooming outside our window. At 4:00 p.m. a homemade afternoon snack is ready for all in the Courtyard. Also the homemade pastries served at breakfast are a real treat as well as fresh fruit and Yogurt. Take advantage of the services of the Spa, as well as the swimming pool and Spa pool. Euro-Spa and Inn is on a quiet street but only a couple of blocks away from Lincoln Ave., the main street of Calistoga, in the heart of the wine country of California.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: MMMTIGER
Reviews.Content: Pros: Breakfast included fruit, hard boiled eggs and granola. The 2 Massages I had @ the Spa were a delight! This was what we used to call a "motor hotel", they improved it very well. Keep in mind this is not a NEW property folks. With only a few rooms and a big area for breakfast and afternoon snacks it turned into a nice social area. Cons: NO MINERAL WATER in the pool or spa!!! I talked to the big guy at the front desk and he got snarky and told me they never advertised that there was mineral water! AND No late check out!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of an inn, right in the heart of wine country.”
Reviews.Author: CakeLady9652
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE staying at EuroSpa & Inn. Lovely, comfortable rooms, great pool and hot tub, excellent full service spa, and a delicious breakfast by the fireside every morning, including fresh baked goodies by most accomodating hosts Bill & Joanne. After a day of winetasting, afternoon snacks on the patio take the edge off before walking a short two blocks into Calistoga for dinner and entertainment. Wonderful, wonderful. Already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kimnoreen
Reviews.Content: From the moment you receive your confirmation until you check out, you feel as though you are genuinely welcome. The rooms are clean and comfortable ~ and the extra touches of wine tasting and home made cookies reminded us of the way the hotels of yesteryear treated us. An absolute pleasure, we will return. Frank & Kim Anderson

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: supuffo
Reviews.Content: My husband, our children and I had a lovely stay at the Eurospa and Inn in Calistoga. The style of the hotel is motel, which means that the rooms are separated and with parking in front. This hotel is small and feels cozy. Our room was number 9 and it is a two rooms accommodations with a king size bed in the first room when you enter, and the queen size in the other room. The bathroom is very large with a shower and the bath tup with the jacuzzi. We had plenty of room. There is also a lot of common space outside on the patio when also breakfast and snacks are served and near the pool. So it does not feel crowded. It is close to town and several interesting wineries. I had the mud wrap and massage treatment while the kids went biking with my husband. The facilities are clean and well maintained and the staff is competent. The massage was one of the best I ever had. We will be back to Eurospa if we go back to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “OK-Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyV
Reviews.Content: After reading very positive reviews of the EuroSpa & Inn I expected more of the motel style rooms and was somewhat disappointed. Our room was OK - although it was too crowded with furniture, somewhat dated, wobbly lamps and it always seemed dark in the room. The bathroom had been decently updated but a well worn battered/stained dresser next to the sink should have been updated/replaced. The price of accommadations was good, the breakfast good and very nice robes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a mid-week stay”
Reviews.Author: jrc7777
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other positive comments. The jetted Jacuzzi tube is just the thing after a day of driving.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden GEM!”
Reviews.Author: SusanMcP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GEM, hidden in the Northern end of the historic Napa Valley. The rooms are clean, reasonably price, comfortable with gas fireplaces adding to the ambiance. The room had a jacuzzi tub and shower with wonderful products. We cannot rave enough about Bill's homemade granola and the coffee served by Joanne in the morning. Not to mention the strudel and Bill's puff pastry with eggs and bacon on Saturday morning. The location is SO MUCH NICER than the more pricey and pretentious Napa or St. Helena yet is only 15 minutes from downtown St. Helena. In our opinion (and we travel to Napa every 3 years or so to restock our cellar), we have found our perfect hotel. We did not try the Spa services but saw the effect on guests who had spent the day in the spa! Everyone looked relaxed and rejuvenated.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarD_SF
Reviews.Content: It's challenging to find a quaint location in Napa Valley without breaking the bank. We're a no frills type of couple, but still expect great service, great location, and nice, clean, updated room. We got all of that during our stay. The continental breakfast was nicer than what most hotels promise (homemade pastries, granola, fresh fruit, and boiled eggs). The innkeepers were very nice; you could feel their pride in the details. And the room was also better than expected; I stayed in this same hotel before it was renovated and the improvements make it worth much more than the price we paid. Plus, having a fridge and microwave was a bonus! Only downside is that the walls are a little thin, but not so much so that you couldn't get a nice evening's rest. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfortable and relaxing"”
Reviews.Author: gaelgal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a spontaneous one night stay at Euro Spa and Inn. What a delightful place with all of the amenities of a 4 star hotel. Afternoon cookies, cider, fireplace in every room, jacuzzi tub (large enough for two) and a wonderful spa on premises. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and we were quite happy with our stay. Would definitely go again and highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great hospitality, super clean; cookies, pastry and granola way out of this world!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinevalleyfarms
Reviews.Content: Bill and Joanne are the greatest hosts - helped us with selection of restaurants, gave us directions. The room was super clean, beds were great, the place was spic and span. The whole experience was tremendously relaxing. Cookies were served in the afternoon and we warmed them up in our microwave. Breakfast was like non other with the homemade granola loaded with walnuts, and cashews, and toasted just right. The fruit was wonderful to look at and great to eat. The apple turnovers were homemade to perfection. The Inn is conveniently located for any kind of travel. The Inn was recommended to us by friends who also went to the St Helena Hospital, patients like us of Dr. Coon.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and warm”
Reviews.Author: nlevantian
Reviews.Content: I would like to go back - quiet and relaxed atmosphere, close to everything and secluded at he same time, and yes! the breakfast was included - yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: meganthemegan
Reviews.Content: Delightful managers made us feel very welcome. Quiet, peaceful and well-maintained grounds. Room was very well kept -- and I loved the robes and jacuzzi! Great continental breakfast selections and nice afternoon snacks. Spa massage rooms are very welcoming/relaxing -- and the therapsist are GREAT! I think this is the best value for a stay in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Eurospa is terrific lodging appropriate for all ages”
Reviews.Author: tess043
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eurospa with our children, ages 6 and 9. We were excited about staying in the wine country but weren't sure where it would be both appropriate and affordable to stay with our kids. Eurospa was wonderful. It's an intimate property walking distance to town. There is an expanded continental breakfast that is tasty. And it's close to wineries, some of which are family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find In Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: suchagoodcook
Reviews.Content: We were in Napa on a wine tasting vacation. We finished our day in Calistoga and found our way to the Eruospa and Inn. I had selected all of my accommodations via the internet and wasn't sure what we would really find. What we did find was the cutest Inn that suited us perfectly. The town is quaint, charming and perfect at the end of a day wine tasting. Our room was spacious, clean and everything we needed to relax and get a great night sleep. There are several dining choice in town that is just a 5 -6 minute walk away. The Inn has a continental breakfast in the morning that was healthy, delicous and the perfect way to start the day. We did not try any of the spa services but I did see several people leaving the spa that looked very relaxed and commented that they had a great massage. The staff was friendly and made you feel at home. The price was very fair and quite a deal when compared to alternative accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: luckjr
Reviews.Content: Crisp, clean, welcoming, & a terrific location combined to make this a great choice for lodging in Calistoga. Especially liked the pool and hot tub area that backed up to open space and vineyard, and the cozy breakfast area with roaring fireplace to take the morning chill off! Bill & Joanne have succeeded in creating a hospitable and very appealing 'home away from home' for travelers. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had more time”
Reviews.Author: armyhusker
Reviews.Content: Hotel was peaceful and quiet. I think there were only 8 rooms to this hotel. Very quaint. Hotel owner was accomodating and friendly. Complimentary breakfast was good. Very clean. I would have liked a full length mirror...only thing I can think of as a drawback. No major issues. Wished we would have had more time to enjoy. Had a massage at the spa and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rolane
Reviews.Content: EuroSpa was a wonderful place to stay. Off the main highway, but close enough to walk to downtown Calistoga. Owners were very nice and helpful. Rooms were big, clean and quiet. The little extras is why we will stay at Eurospa on our next visit to Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: cstrvlr
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Napa and stayed at the Euro Spa and Inn. The stay was great. Somehow the rsvp got messed up, but they were very accommodating and they gave us the room for the same price since we already paid for it. We also took advantage of their spa and got massages. It was an overall great experience. Everyone in the town was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Eurospa”
Reviews.Author: pjinazPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurospa for four nights from September 11th through the 15th. I researched a lot of hotels/inns in the Napa Valley and picked the Eurospa, but wasn't sure if it would be the right choice. We were so happy! The place is so cute and so comfortable. The little things that make a nice place were all provided, very nice robes, great towels, super clean room/bathroom, even cotton balls in the bathroom, little patios outside rooms with furniture, great wireless service. Room was perfect, pool area was so nice, it was like being in a friend's beautiful backyard. The granola and fruit at breakfast were yummo! My husband who is sooo picky also loved the place. Also really liked Calistoga, great location and fun little town, with plenty of decent restaurants. The staff was so nice and helpful. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Even better with the third visit”
Reviews.Author: ESJT
Reviews.Content: Joanne and Bill continue to do very well with the Eurospa and Inn operations. The outdoor continental breakfasts with a fireplace and opportunity to talk with other guests makes it very pleasant. This is a classy place. Rooms are very comfortable, we tried three different rooms this trip - each different but unique in their own way. The location is just right for the wine country. Calistoga is a neat small town with good things to see and do. Very good value from several aspects. We look forward to the fourth visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful cozy place with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Stilinovich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night and it was so relaxing and peaceful. The staff was very friendly. It was convenient to walk out of your room and walk to the spa for a treatment. We enjoyed the massage so much that the next morning we went back for mini-facials. The room was clean, with a mini kitchen area and jacuzzi bath tub. We will definitely be staying here again, soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Wilson080
Reviews.Content: My family spent two nights here after five hectic days in San Francisco. We were welcomed with sparkling cider and home-made cookies on the porch before taking a dip in the pool. The lovely quaint town of Calistoga was a few minutes walk away from the inn and well worth looking around - I would recommed a visit to the museum as it holds a lot of local historical information. The place to eat is Pacifico's, a Mexican restaurant with a lovely outside eating area. Back at the inn, the suite we had booked had a spacious bedroom with double bed and the main room had the king bed, TV, fridge,sink and coffee maker. Robe's and pool towles were provided. The bathroom was large with a huge whirlpool tub plus a shower. In the morning, breakfast is served on the porch with cereals, fresh fruit, breads, juice, coffee, tea etc and was quite sufficient. My daughter and I booked a massage at the spa within the inn which was a lovely way to unwind after our travels.

Reviews.Title: “great value - large, clean rooms with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelfrance2009
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Calistoga, after traveling through a few other places in Northern California, we were pleasantly surprised at how large and well equipped our room was. The place is clean and recently renovated and very comfortable. It is walking distance to town and has everything we need. I love hotels that provide a refrigerator and a microwave. We got a king room and the bed is very comfortable. The robes and fluffy towels are a nice touch. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: vvvanessa
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded from a queen to a king in a free-standing cabin (room #6) for a $5 charge. the room is spacious, the bed comfortable. the jacuzzi tub is a great touch. the small fridge and microwave came in handy as well. we used both the heater and the little gas "fireplace" which warmed the room well. the property seemed to be very well tended and clean. the pool area was immaculate, and i, who can't get in a pool that's even slightly cool, was able to dip right in. buffet breakfast was simple but very adequate: muffins, toast, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, copious fruit salad, orange juice oatmeal, granola. desk staff was helpful. excellent wifi connection and free, easy parking. my only problem was that they ran out of non-feather pillows so definitely ask for them ahead of time if you need them. located in the heart of calistoga with easy access to spas, wineries, restaurants, shops.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Winedinetravel
Reviews.Content: We found this lovely inn by accident, looking for 3 rooms, all of us on sorts of a budget. The owners did a fantastic job upgrading this property which once must have been a simple place. The rooms are thoughtfully and comfortably furnished and every room has a coffeemaker, fridge, bottled water, bar sink. Whirlpool tubs in the bathrooms, robes, a nice pool and jacuzzi, all close to town, but away from the noise. Nice afternoon refreshments and breakfast included in the reasonable (especially for Napa Valley!) rates...and the people working there couldn't be nicer or more helpful. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Eurospa Inn”
Reviews.Author: sm852
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because of the hotel's easy access to Highway 29 and the Silverado Trail. We stayed for two nights and enjoyed our stay very much. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel itself was charming and quaint. Breakfast and afternoon snacks were a nice bonus. We stayed in the queen room, and while some people may consider the room small by American standards, it was a lot bigger than some hotel rooms I've seen in Europe. We felt it was lovely and cozy. Although the walls are a tiny bit on the thin side... Great value for money and I look forward to staying there the next time I am up in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Owner pulled a bait and switch...sleazy.”
Reviews.Author: cmm323
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay in Calistoga so I could take in the famous mineral springs. This place looked nice enough online, had a pool and jacuzzi so I called and spoke to the owner Bill who told me their pool and jacuzzi are not mineral water, but that as guests of this hotel we'd have the reciprocal use of Village Inn down the road, which seemed a little inconvenient, but fine since I've been there too, and it's nice. So I booked 5 nights in a QQ. Arrived from NYC more than ready to soak, only to be told that the Village Inn part of the deal was no longer available (in the week since I had last spoken to him?!), I insisted he should have notified me, and that I would stay someplace elese, but he argued that he had never put it in writing and that his word meant nothing, and that I would still have to pay for my room We had to pay $25pp for a day pass ($50 extra a day) to go use another local place with mineral springs, and he flatly refused to acknowledge that this was a bati and switch and was an extremely unpleasant person. He ended up charging me for a QQ even though I had checked into a single. (warning the QQ is a dark room off the owner's house, I switched to a single king when I saw how dark it was and how it was almost part of the front desk). The rooms seemed clean enough, but way over priced for what you got - basically a motel room a few blocks from the main street. Moved to Calistoga Spa, which had similar posted rates but they gave me a mid-week discount and a huge room with a kitchen for less, so I ended up saving money and having the 5 pools right outside my room (ahhh). Won't make same mistake twice, hope you don't either!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pgrast
Reviews.Content: My sister recommended this little place in Calistoga, and we were not disappointed. We like staying in family run businesses, and the folks here were very nice. Breakfast was great, too! Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cozy, romantic gem for a quick weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: BMWinNV
Reviews.Content: Eurospa and Inn was a welcome surprise. This was our third trip to Calistoga for a quick weekend getaway and we were not disappointed. The gas fireplace in the room was perfect for a romantic evening, the bistro seating out on the front porch was a great place for coffee. The bathrooms were spacious compared to other comparable inns nearby, and the kitchenette was great. There are little touches that make it perfect. The spa and pool are small but very enjoyable with a view of the hills and the wines growing next door. It was clean and the proprietors were very friendly. A block walk is all you have to get to downtown Calistoga. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and recently renovated with very friendly staff...but uncomfortable bed is a deal breaker.”
Reviews.Author: otterclover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard king bed room. When we travel, we typically stay at 3 to 4 star hotels. Here's a list of our opinions/experiences: Pros: 1. Very clean facility, inside and outside, that has been renovated recently from what appeared to have been a motel (like a lot of the hotels/spas in Calistoga) 2. Free wifi (although connection was very spotty during peak use hours in the evening) 3. Gas fireplace 4. Friendly staff at the Inn and at the Spa 5. Complimentary bottles of water in the refrigerator 6. Fluffy towels Cons: 1. Hard, thin bed. Sleeping on my side was uncomfortable due to hip pains (even with pillow between my knees) and my arm falling asleep. Sleeping on my back was uncomfortable due to the bed springs. This is the reason for docking 2 stars - otherwise, we'd give this place 4 stars overall. I'm glad we scheduled the spa session on our last day because it came in handy to work out the knots from the bed. 2. Lack of power plugs - especially near the one table in the room. We lucked out and the office staff had a spare extension cord we could borrow for our laptop. We would consider staying again as we thought EuroSpa place had better/cuter renovations than other similarly priced hotels in the area but not until the uncomfortable beds are replaced. The pool/jacuzzi area was really well renovated (new furniture and cabana) but not every guest will use those amenities. Every guest will use the bed! Same for the shower - not every guest will use the nice jet tub but they will use the shower (which was a low flow shower head). We would recommend to other travelers (assuming the bed is not an issue for them).

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet and Just What I'd Hoped”
Reviews.Author: N2youreye
Reviews.Content: After researching all my options here on Trip Advisor, I decided to go with EuroSpa because of the value and reviews. I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a place to stay. We arrived on a beautiful Oct afternoon and checked in. We selected the deluxe king room. It was very clean, had a 2 person whirlpool spa, separate shower, fireplace, coffee maker, fridge, and wet bar area. We couldn't find anything wrong with it! The rooms seemed quiet, as I never heard the 4 people staying in the room next to us. We didnt' use the pool area, as we were only there one night. They have more than a continental breakfast available in the "nook" area that is included. We elected to take plates to our room (or you can sit by their outdoor fireplace and enjoy your meal). We didn't use the spa services but were given information just in case we did. It is about 1/2 mi or less to the restaurants and downtown area. We ate at Brannan's Grill which was amazing. yum...i still can't get my mind off of the yummy dinner my hubby and I had there. This isn't the Westin or super upscale hotel, but then again you're in Calistoga not SF so this fits perfectly with the area. I was happy that I could have the door open and feel comfortable or go out on my front patio. I can't wait to go back to this property, as I feel like I've been missing out on the wonderful opportunity so close to my home.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: EllenSD
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at EuroSpa & Inn very much The rooms were comfortable, clean and smelled good. The gas stove fireplace warmed up the room very nicely, the whirlpool tub was grand and the little kitchenette was just what we needed for the snacks we purchased. The breakfast was tasty and satisfying. We went mid week so the Inn and downtown was quiet. A short walk to downtown Calistoga to enjoy good food at decent prices (Sarafornia, Pacifico and Flatiron Grill). Great service every where we went. Had fun at Golden Haven for a couples mud bath. We liked the coffee and scones in the early morning at the Roastery. Beer at Calistoga Brewery and Hydro Bar and Grill. Calistoga is definitely a place to visit and EuroSpa & Inn is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: kentsmaid
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this cosy Inn. Very convenient to downtown. Older building that has been refurbished, and they did a good job. Bedrooms are small but very comfy bed, modern bathroom and excellent breakfast/ Our hosts were helpful and charming. Would make a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very quite, comfy beds, soft sheets and towels, and loved the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: MargiePasoRobles_Ca_
Reviews.Content: We looked at several places and I was happy that we picked this one. It is two blocks from town which removed us from all the noise of the cars. Great pastries and fresh fruit in the morning. I loved the mud wrap which was two doors down so I could walk over in my robe. Large bathroom and I loved the shower. The beds were great and they have good quality sheets and towels. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly good place”
Reviews.Author: jshien
Reviews.Content: after much research we found this place and got a great mid week deal. i was a little skeptical at first didnt know what to expect. i didnt want spend too much for a room that we were planning on being in for 8 hrs max. eurospa and inn was perfect! they were greet on the phone booking our room. the rooms are a little dark and on the small side but the bathroom was quite spacious with a corner jacuzzi tub and seperate shower. there is a public courtyard area with fireplace and seating. they have cookies and cider during the day. breakfast is included and is set out in this area as well. we chose to eat it in the courtyard but i noticed some ppl taking it to their rooms or to table outside the rooms. the breakfast was suprisingly good! nice variety of fresh fruit, organic yoghurt, cereal, oatmeal, toast. some ppl might say its just a motel but its def not. its got lots of charm and quite cute. i felt it suited our needs perfectly. the only downside was the location. its located off the main strip almost in a residential area. but its really only 5 minutes walk to the main street where all the restaurants and shops are. it can get kind of dark at night. the town seems to lack street lights in the residential areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.... easy and cute pool!”
Reviews.Author: Munzi
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay off the main strip by a block. The room was perfect... not fancy but nice with a big whirl pool tub. The pool is a nice place to relax in the afternoon. Breakfast was great too. Not a fancy hotel but a good deal for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfied - wonderful place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Cornpanzer
Reviews.Content: Rooms were roomy and comfortable. Very clean! Pool is small, but very quiet and tucked away near the back. Owners were oh so accomodating (Thanks!) with a wonderful little nook to eat and great suggestions for wineries to visit. Resteraunt choices in Calistoga are a bit limited, but you are not far froma couple other towns. We felt that three nights were perfect for Calistoga. We combied this stay with a few days in SF, so it was nice to spend time in the warm sun around the pool after chilly SF. Hopefully we will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Calistoga, hands down”
Reviews.Author: realdream
Reviews.Content: This wonderful spot is the perfect place to stay in Calistoga. Joanne and Bill, the innkeepers, are gracious and considerate, and know their business. The rates are the lowest in town, but this spa/inn is clearly the best of all the places we've stayed in town over the past 25 years. The complimentary breakfast is homemade and delicious, and Joanne makes scrumptious chocolate chip cookies every afternoon which, along with fresh fruit and Martinelli's apple cider, grace the lovely outdoor eating porch from 4-6. The rooms are clean, warm and comfortable. The TV and the AC work great and the shower/bath are fine. The swimming pool and hot tub are excellent, and the staff couldn't be nicer. We were able to get into our room before check-in time and left after checkout time, and nobody hassled us--in fact, they accomodated us. What a concept--customer service! One thing to know--the pool and jacuzzi are not fed by the mineral hot springs, but 8/10 of a mile--a two-minute drive--down the main road is the legendary Village Inn, which is in disrepair but still open. They have a reciprocal arrangement with Eurospa for the use of their excellent mineral pools, hot tub, and sauna--just show up, tell 'em Joanne sent you, and you're in. My wife and daughter took advantage of the on-site spa servies (massage and facial), which they described as "heavenly". The other guests were really nice, and the whole ambience of the place is really warm--a great vibe. Finally, you cannot beat the location. Two short tree-lined blocks from Lincoln Street (the main drag), walking distance to several good restaurants, and quiet. Sometimes you don't have to spend an arm and a leg to have the nicest little time in Calistoga. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: ktinuch
Reviews.Content: The EuroSpa & Inn was the perfect place for my mom and me to stay for a long "girls weekend." Very hospitable and welcoming. The room was large and clean and very comfortable. The massages we had at the spa were amazing!! We enjoyed breakfast everyday at the Inn and walking to the town of Calistoga. Great location and experience. I can't recommend it enough if you are looking for a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Epiffinie8
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about having a romantic Calistoga get-away, especially since we are first time parents with a 10 month old. My Mother in law gave us a gift certificates to tour nearby Castello di Amorosa. The castle wine tour was amazing and beautiful! I chose Euro Spa & Inn because it was very close (3 miles) to the winery, had a spa in house, pool, and walking distance from down town Calistoga. Their website seemed great. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed considering the room was $181 only because we booked a couples massage. Our room was tiny, but very clean. The pool was descent, but you could tell at one point this place must have been a couple of houses or a refurbished motel. Our bed was extremely uncomfortable. The couple's massage set in a tiny room, was definitely not worth $150 per person we paid. I don't mind paying $200 for a hotel or $150 for a massage...if they are worth it. Unfortunately, the Euro Spa & Inn failed on both counts.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: tarzan99
Reviews.Content: We are in budget mode this year, and I booked our stay with trepidation. We would usually stay at a more 'upscale' resort, but the reviews looked good and the price was great, so we took the chance and booked a stay at Eurospa. I cannot begin to express how GREAT this place is. When we pulled in, I was resigned for a mediocre motel. Instead, it is the coolest little place, better than I could have imagined. The rooms are nicely done, the pool area feels as if you are in a private retreat with beautiful vistas and lovely grassy areas. The 'motor-court' aspect has a retro feel, and sitting on your front porch we got to see and chat with people coming and going. The continental breakfast was superb, with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, toast, etc. Bottom line, this is now the only place we'll stay when we go to Calistoga!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway location”
Reviews.Author: cindylou57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night but would have enjoyed staying longer. The location is great! The room was nice with a wet bar, microwave, fridge and small table. Huge, clean bathroom and comfy beds in our two room 'suite'. The pool area was nice, we used the pool and the hot tub. Fresh fruit and cookies were served in the afternoon on the open air patio and we carried it to eat at our table by the pool. Breakfast was also served on the open air patio, very nice touch. The desk clerks were pleasant and helpful. Our stay preceded a fabulous day in Napa Valley which we won't soon forget and lived up to all our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to stay for Girl's Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kellera32
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Euro Spa and Inn for about 4 years now, and always have a great time. My girlfriends and I found this hotel, because they have a nice pool, good continental breakfast and it is an excellent location. Close to our spa, and close to downtown. We walk everywhere. Bill and Joanne are very nice and accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: As we drove into the rather diminutive parking lot, I looked at my wife and said "this could be interesting." With two kids under age 5 in the back seat, my initial thought was that our family would offer Eurospa all that it could handle. We stayed here for a night, because the owner's other property, Stevenson Manor didn't have any vacancy on the Friday of our 3 night stay in Calistoga. All I can say is that this quaint spot more than held its own. The room while a bit tight, surprisingly accommodated our son's pack-n-play as well as the rollaway bed the staff brought in for our daughter. It was very clean and had some nice additions like a wet bar, small refrigerator, and microwave. One red mark on the room was the towel rack, which fell off when I first reached for a towel. Yet, after a call to the front desk it was fixed within 15 minutes. The grounds at first glance seem compact, but really were quite comfortable. With a small sitting area on the deck in front of our room, a rose garden with Adirondack chairs to relax, and pool with grassy areas on either side of it the kids were able to move around and keep interested. Not only was it more than enough for my little ones, but also for what I believe were 3 other families with small children there that day. The covered outdoor eating area for the continental breakfast as well as afternoon snacks was a nice touch and something enjoyed by the whole family. At a lower price than many places in Calistoga, I think that Eurospa falls into the category of hidden gem. Even its location, a couple blocks off the main drag, only serves to strengthen this description.

Reviews.Title: “Great old tourist court (with current amenities)”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff, good breakfast and afternoon snack, wonderful in room robes, good parking.

Reviews.Title: “nice, good value accommodation with some extras”
Reviews.Author: 4DeltaMike
Reviews.Content: A mere stroll from downtown Calistoga. We had a good sized room, clean and modern inside, and with a really quiet but effective ceiling fan. Enjoyed the serve-yourself breakfast in the open-air communal area, and with a Thursday and Friday night stay averaging at around $180 a night in the high price town of Calistoga it was good value. The massages were excellent, and while the pool is on the small side it was nice to have a dip and a lie by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recomend-could not fault”
Reviews.Author: Emob313
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Inn after a week of travelling around California. So it was a fantastic place to recharge our batteries and to chill by the pool. The location was great as it is only a couple minutes walk to the main street. The room was spotless and the bed was so comfortable. It was a really relaxing place as we weren't bothered too early in the morning by noise, housekeeping etc (unlike other hotels which we had previously stayed). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable, perfect location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ERWL
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a comfortable, covenient place in Napa Valley, this is the one. It's convenient to all the Napa Valley, Sonoma Valley and surrounding vineyards. It's clean, well-kept, has great breakfast, and quiet. There are numerous spa services at a reasonable price. The managers are friendly and helpful. Eurospa is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to recharge”
Reviews.Author: meardynit
Reviews.Content: This room was wonderful - a VERY comfortable bed and fabulous whirlpool tub. A nice continental breakfast too. Highly recommended - we will definitely stay here again next time we are in wine country.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure for Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: southbaytravelers
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Eurospa with visiting friends from Austria. Very comfortable beds, great jacuzzi tub and shower. Delicious, generous continental breakfast enjoyed outdoors by the fireplace. We were all delighted with this wonderful find! Bonnie & Chuck Campbell, CA

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure...”
Reviews.Author: PVlcan
Reviews.Content: Just a few miles past St. Helena is one of the best and most affordable places in the valley. The EuroSpa and Inn is ideal for business or vacation travel. The staff welcomes you, like an old friend of the family. Bill and Joanne are wonderful hosts. The complimentary breakfast and afternoon appetizers by the fire are a personal favorite. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. This trip was for fun and the four of us really enjoyed sitting on the deck outside our room - drinking wine, of course. Looking forward to my next trip to Napa and a chance to stay at the EuroSpa and Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The Man Running the Place is TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: mammaisontheinternet
Reviews.Content: The room itself was fine. No complaints. It seemed slightly overpriced at $140/nt but the wine country isn't cheap. The location was pretty nice as well. The breakfast was so-so at best. When we checked in, there was this terribly rude and unhelpful older man (60-ish) who was working the desk. He had a foul attitude, he was rude to my partner and it gave us a very bad taste in our mouth. I highly recommend avoiding this place. We talked with staff at other places in town and they seemed much better suited for the hospitality industry.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for a relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: RosevilleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I went here with a friend for a girlfriends spa getaway weekend and was very pleased with our experience. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We also used the spa services during our stay -- facial and massage -- and were thrilled with our experience. Felt and looked great afterward. The staff at the spa made it a relaxing experience. It's not a fancy spa (no murals, elaborate decor, etc.) but still very relaxing. The room was very clean and comfortable. It wasn't a "Wow!" but had everything you could need and room to move around. Modern decor. Bathroom was spacious, although all of the fixtures worked backwards (just a curious thing, not an annoyance). The place is within walking distance to Lincoln St. (main area) -- just a block away -- so a great location. Quiet area, too. The deluxe continental breakfast included pastries, cereals/milk, english muffins, toast, hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, orange juice, coffee, A lot to choose from and we were satisfied with our meal. They also served homemade (wonderful!) chocolate macadamia nut cookies with sparkling apple cider in the evening. We heard that the place is changing ownership, so I'm not sure what, if anything, will change. Regardless, I would definitely go back again when visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “truly a perfect spot for our get away...”
Reviews.Author: LauraHegarty
Reviews.Content: I am 8+ months pregnant with my first child and my Sister and I decided to get take a little vacation together and get away before the baby came and relax. We decided on Calistoga and stayed at this darling little spot called Euro Spa. The little charming hotel is located right off the main drag (walking distance from town) and was the perfect place for us. Every morning they offer a continental breakfast complimentary and on occasion (if you’re lucky) the manager (who is the nicest man) cooks a fresh warm strudel for guests. Breakfast is served on this outdoor, covered patio with a small fire pit and is a lovely way to start your day! The hotel room itself also has a small fireplace and was as charming as can be. All and all we give the Eurp Spa a two thumbs up and we’d be delighted to stay there again (which they make quite easy for you—upon check-out we were given passes for returning guests offering a phenomenal return rate)! Thanks you Euro Spa for making our experience so memorable—it was truly a perfect spot for our get away. We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: things_of_times
Reviews.Content: We went to the EuroSpa and Inn after one of our friend recommand it.What a deception! People at the reception were totally unfriendly,rooms are small for the price they charge,cannot be able to park in front of our room,no soap or products for the 2nd night we stay in,no coffee or croissant for breakfeast (we have to run for it and it seems that we disturb the lady at the front desk!).Massages are great but you can stay somewhere else in Calistoga and come here for it.Really not a good memory for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hsam
Reviews.Content: Would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend it. Comfortable beds, great spa, spacious bathroom, nice little pool and hot tub and fantastic breakfast. Good location. Only downside is that our room did not get much sunlight. Very very minor detail.

Reviews.Title: “A nice home base for touring the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: FloppyD
Reviews.Content: The owners are super friendly and nice. They were very welcoming from the get go. This made up for any negatives about the place ( tiny pool, smaller rooms). Positives are awesome breakfast, friendly staff, large bathrooms with big tubs, super clean.,and great location off a side street but still within walking distance to Lincoln Ave. We were checking out on the 4th of July and they let us keep our car in the parkling lot so we could go watch the town parade without the hassle of trying to move the car during the busiest few hours the town ever sees. Breakfast was lovely. A nice spread of pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereals, and hard boiled eggs. Great coffee and juice. Newspapers too. The rooms are nice, not big but the bathrooms are huge. Get a room with a jacuzzi tub for two. The only downside is that the pool is bite size. Its very tiny, though it was nice and warm and had a scenic view. This would be a great place to use as a home base for exploring wine country. If you came back in the evening to crash here and wake up here you would be happy. Its just not a place you are going to set up shop at and lounge by the pool because of how small it is. I bet it is nice in the winter as the rates are lower and the room we had had a cute little fireplace. The outdoor area where we had breakfast also had a cool swiss fireplace. Very cozy! and with the jacuzzi in your room you would be all set. P.S. They offer a AAA discount if you mention that you are a member.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: tulip52
Reviews.Content: A most pleasant and laid-back stay for 3 nts here...perfect location to wonderful wineries, restaurants. Our room was spacious and very clean. We loved that the quaint town of Calistoga was just a short walk...some cool stores and restaurants...Calistoga Inn was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful stay”
Reviews.Author: DJDxMKD
Reviews.Content: The Eurospa and Inn is located on a small side street in a residential area of Calistoga, within very easy walking distance to the center of town. We stayed in the #1 cottage (1st on the left as you drive in). The inn has more of a "motel" feel to it than an "inn" or "hotel", you drive into a center courtyard (asphalt paved) that has the rooms all round (feel like cottages, but are all attached). The room was basic, but nicely furnished with a comfortable bed, table & chairs, a club chair and ottoman, a small "kitchenette" with microwave, sink, fridge and coffee maker. Basic bath, nothing special, but nothing to complain about.
