During our 3 days in Napa, we spent relatively little time in the room, so (unless I'm staying at a resort type facitlity where the point is to be there and not leave) I basically want a clean, simple room that I can relax in when needed to, but don't feel like I'm wasting alot of money when we are not there. Calistoga is at the top of the valley, so it is a bit out of the way compared to Oakville, Napa or St. Helena, but nothing is a tremendously far away, and we rented a mustang conv. so driving around the valley was just as enjoyable as visiting the wineries. Convenient to Napa-Botha park (we went horseback riding there). Downtown Calistoga has a few restaurants, so if you were staying there for several days, it would be easy to eat a few different places in town if you were so inclinded (we really only visited a few wineries a day, but even so, at the end of the day, we really never felt the need for a complete dinner), we ate in town at Bar Vino one night, nice light meal sort of Tapas style (but not, a little bigger plates), skipped dinner altogether another night, and ate at Bouchon another night (most places seem to close early, Bouchon has late seating that was real convenient) Overall, i'd recommend the Eurospa if you are looking for a place to hang your hat and not alot of frills, reasonbale prices (in an expensive area), and quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “EuroSpa & Inn is as good as it gets in Northern California”
Reviews.Author: ESJT
Reviews.Content: We were on a spontaneously developed trip into Northern California and we, quite by accident, came upon the EuroSpa & Inn. We called the day of our arrival and with extraordinary luck they just had a cancellation. So we were in. Joanne and Bill Clazmer have an exceptionally nice and in addition, reasonably priced, Inn. It is B&B. The bedrooms are neat and the beds are very comfortable. The food is really good and "plentiful". The EuroSpa is very well located in Calistoga and makes a nice base of adventuring into the wine country. As hoteliers the Clazmers are "on duty" for their guests and one feels like a guest, if not a member of the family, in a first rate Inn. we look forward to a return trip, this next time not chancing the EuroSpa having a "new" cancellation. We were lucky and we enjoyed the luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel/hotel/spa”
Reviews.Author: Work2TravelUk
Reviews.Content: Great location just a block off the main street in the quiet town of Calistoga. The rooms are clean and well equipped. Complimentary breakfast. There is a small pool and hot tub which other guests enjoyed and spoke highly of. There is also a basic spa on site which we didn't get time to use. Easy to walk to the main street where all the shops, restaurants and bars are located. Good value and a great base for touring the Napa Valley

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gardengypsy
Reviews.Content: This was a great stop on our way through Napa. My family stayed in other rooms as well so I got a good look at this place. The pool area is behind the property and quiet. The patio area out front for all the patrons is perfect for relaxing with your wine and cheese or breakfast and newspapers. The rooms are cozy but provide everything you need including wine glasses and refrigerator. The only downside I found was that our bed was fairly uncomfortable, they would definitely benefit from some cushy mattress covers. My uncle stayed in room #12 which closest to the patio area and he said he could hear everyone in the morning while they were eating breakfast and he was trying to sleep. Other than that I can find no problems with the service, location or in general. We walked to dinner (2 blocks) and ate at a great Mexican place called Pacifico and it was tasty. Oh and we loved that we had a deep, jetted tub in our standard room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Clean Pool, Short walk to town”
Reviews.Author: keninca
Reviews.Content: Reconditioned Motel with drive in courtyard which may be an issue for some people used to proper parking lots off in the distance. Frankly, I was concerned until I got to experience the property and ended up deciding the parking courtyard was part of its charm in a retro sort of way. This property is very well tended and in very good shape, the staff is exceedingly friendly, and the small cozyness makes even the guests friendly. We had great chats with some of the other guests: something rare at most other bigger hotels. Rooms are nice. Very comfortable King bed in mine. There was a kitchenette with a fridge and a microwave (and a bag of microwave popcorn). There's a clean pool in back of property with hot tub overlooking a vinyard (I think, but I was seeing vinyards in my sleep by the time we left :-) ). A Spa is on site for massages mud baths, etc. (I didnt' get a chance to sample it). Great continental breakfast with pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit, toast, juice, and coffee, served in the covered common area by the office. They also serve some snacks in the afternoon. The manager was *very* helpful, booking a pair of dinners for my party of 8, as well as a limo to take us on a tasting trip. Property is 2 block walk from the main street and it's attractions. Not a McDonnalds, or other franchise in sight. Calistoga is wonderfully free of the corporate homoginization afflicting the rest of the US, and EuroSpa does it's part in helping create this differentiating ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Oct 2006 - Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie28
Reviews.Content: The Euro Spa & Inn has a cottagey feel when you drive up. It has a small but nice pool as well as a lawn to sunbathe in (we were the only ones who used the pool and lawnchairs for the 3 nights we stayed there). Our room was on the smallish side, but had a comfortable bed and a whirlpool tub in the bathroom. The continental breakfast was ok, but nothing to write home about. We preferred to walk a few blocks to downtown Calistoga and eat and one of the many great restaurants. I’d say the best thing about the Euro Spa & Inn are the spa treatments. Book early (either before you get there or the day you check in) because the good packages fill up fast. My boyfriend and I got a couples package with a mud wrap and a deep tissue massage and it was by far the BEST massage I’ve ever had. Best of all, the price was totally reasonable (we’ve paid 3 or 4 times as much at high end hotels where the massages were no where near as good as here), The proximity to downtown Calistoga can’t be beat and we would totally stay here again. I love the Calistoga vibe, it’s a small, quaint little town with great food and nice people. I love the Mud Hens shop and every restaurant we ate at was excellent. Throw in proximity to some great winerys and I think it’s a little slice of heaven! Don’t forget to make a reservation for dinner at the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone (about 10 minutes away by car in St. Helena). Hand’s down, one of the best dinners I’ve ever had!

Reviews.Title: “The Relaxing EuroSpa”
Reviews.Author: NYBarbaraR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the EuroSpa for several days in late May 2007. It’s located at the edge of a quiet, residential neighborhood. Our room was comfortable and immaculate. It included a very spacious bathroom (with a Jacuzzi tub for two and fluffy robes!) as well as a sink area and refrigerator. The owners were friendly and provided helpful information about the area when we asked; but, they were not overbearing, which we appreciated. There was a continental breakfast offered every day from 8 – 10AM on the outdoor patio. It included hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, juices, cereals, and fabulous coffee. Snacks and apple cider were offered later in the day. We didn’t take advantage of any of the spa treatments, but we did use the pool in the afternoons. It was located in a grassy, tree-sheltered area. We walked into town almost every night to enjoy the stores and restaurants. Overall, we had a very relaxing visit at the EuroSpa and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet stay in the Calistoga area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Inn”
Reviews.Author: jeffires
Reviews.Content: A very cozy hotel and spa located at the north end of wine country. It is worth the extra drive as you pass through very scenic areas and get to drive through the heart of wine country. This hotel is exactly what their website said it would be. Very cozy, very clean and a friendly staff. My wife and I booked the romantic package and it is worth the money spent. The dinner at Brannons was excellent and the room is nice sized with an oversized bathroom. The spa is no frills but the staff is courteous and attentive. Definitely worth the extra drive from the San Francisco Airport. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean and Affordable!!!”
Reviews.Author: stp21
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms over the internet with another couple. Always a bit weary of if the place will actually be what it looks like online - the Euro Spa was just as cute as we had hoped. We were looking for an affordable and clean option in the Napa area that provided a good location to wineries and restaurants while still offering up some wine country charm. The Euro Spa has a continental breakfast that made mornings easy - but also fun as we sat outside and enjoyed the courtyard. They also provide a "happy hour" of sorts from 4-6pm that was a perfect thing to come back "home" to after a day of touring. A few of us in our group enjoyed massages at the spa. Those are well-priced too. There are certainly fancier places in Calistoga and Napa, but since we didn't spend much time in the room - this was the perfect choice for us. Bill, the guy who runs the Inn with his wife, was also so helpful in recommending wineries, car companies and restaurants...a built in concierge!! The pool and hot tub area are small...but cute, like you are in someone's backyard. Overall, the Inn felt very cozy and made our trip easier and more affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brugal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the fourth night of our most recent trip to California (Feb 25th) in Calistoga at the EuroSpa. We got a great deal online and for the money spent we both felt it was a fantastic value. The hotel is reminiscent of an old motor lodge but was bright, clean and up to date. Our room, a king suite, was quite large containing a comfortable bed with two night tables, dining area, microwave, refrigerator, sink and a decent sized bathroom. Wireless internet was also available free of charge, you just had to get your user ID and password from the front desk when you check in. The location is also a plus. If you've come for the wine tasting you're within a few miles of some good ones. Schramsberg, Bennett Lane, Chateau Montelena and Frank Family to name a few. If you'd prefer to hoof it, downtown is just a few blocks away. We walked to dinner at BarVino which is a tapas restaurant on Lincoln Ave. Besides featuring great food they offer wines by small local vineyards that you would have trouble finding anywhere else. You can buy them by the bottle, glass or 2 oz sampler pour which is nice as it allows you to sample several different wines. And if you happen to really like one they'll sell you a bottle to take home at a discounted retail price. If at this point you're getting a little tired of wine and are craving a beer you'll pass right by the Calistoga Restaurant & Brewery on your walk back to the EuroSpa. If you like to hike, Mt St Helena, a 4,400 gem is just a few miles away. Our original plan included taking time to do this 5 mile hike but the weather was a little sketchy. Breakfast is included and was fine. It consisted of hard boiled eggs, bagels, breads, muffins, cereal, coffee and juices and is served outdoors on the patio. Sit near the fire pit if it's a chilly morning. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it to travelers looking for nice accommodations in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for girls' weekend”
Reviews.Author: rbuffing
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed in the 2-room King suite for a 2-night stay. We were very satisfied with the facilities, service, location, and price. The photos on their Website accurately portray the interiors of the rooms - very clean and modern. The room also included a kitchenette (fridge, microwave, coffee maker, sink) with a cafe table and chairs. Perfect for the mini-feast we brought back from Dean & Delucca. They do provide VERY luxurious bathrobes, plenty of towels and pillows, and all the supplies you would expect. The property appears to have started life as a motor-court type motel in the 1940's. The rooms surround the parking lot (not a glamorous effect), but the buildings' exteriors were immaculate. The pool area would benefit from a new, taller fence - the residential neighbors' junky yards were in full view. But the pool and hot tub looked newly-renovated. Hot tub was good 'n hot. We all three indulged in spa services (massage, salt-scrub, facial) and were very satisfied with those as well. The spa manager was especially pleasant and helpful. We did not try the afternoon snacks, but the continental breakfast offered many choices, the food was fresh and tasty, and the outdoor patio was very pleasant. It is a short two-block walk to Calistoga's main drag and we enjoyed walking to dinner and shopping. Eurospa's location in a residential neighborhood prevented us from having to listen to traffic noise. That's a real advantage as a lot of the other Calistoga hotels seem to be right on the main street. This place has everything you need, and no glaring faults. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: exquisitetraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Eurospa and Inn with my two sons and my girlfriend. It was nice and quaint and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay thoroughly. The daily cleaning service with fresh towels and robes were great and the continental breakfast was nice as well. We did not take any spa services but the stay itself was nice. We were lucky to get a manager's special so i feel that it was well worth it. Had we had to pay regular price of 180+ I would feel the charge would be too high. Overall it was good.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Place.. excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Erickajean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned to Minnesota after a wonderful vacation in the Napa wine country.. We loved our stay at the Euro Spa!! The managers, Bill and Joanne went above and beyond with their professional services! They made us feel right at home... The views were spectacular from the swimming pool! We treated ourselves to a couple of treatments at the spa and it was magnificant! The staff at this resort made it worth the trip! We will definately be back and we look forward to visiting your wonderful location again! ... Thank you again.. Bill and Joanne! Your Northern Minnesota guests ... Ericka and Dennis!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our wedding weekend!”
Reviews.Author: AHagelshaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married in California wine country in August 2006, and our entire wedding party stayed two nights at Eurospa in Calistoga. It might sound corny, but our stay was perfect. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the hotel is only two short blocks from cute downtown Calistoga. The pool and jucuzzi are behind the hotel in a well manicured lawn area that looks out into the distance at the surrounding hills- very comfortable in the evenings. We can't recommend Eurospa highly enough! The management was helpful and accomodating, even when we accidentally locked oursleves out of our room late one night, and had patience for our entire group of people every step of the way. Our wedding party (which took all 13 rooms) had nothing but great things to say! We will always have fond memories of our stay at Eurospa, and look forward to going there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gal-Pal Getaway Weekend @ EuroSpa in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Penny'sMom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a July 2006 long weekend in San Fran and the wine country. We four gal-pals stayed 2 nights at the EuroSpa & Inn in Calistoga (north Napa), a small place just off the main Napa thoroughfare (Rt. 29). After spending a day in Sonoma stopping at various wineries (Castle, Imagery, Arrowwood, Cohn) along Rt. 12, we crossed over to Calistoga via Calistoga and Petrified Forest Roads. The hotel reminded us of motels from childhood days -- single story buildings with outdoor entrances that open into the parking lot. About 15 or so rooms, total. There is a nice little pool out back, fenced in, with views of the nearby grape fields and the mountains in the distance. Outside the registration office is a covered area where (free!) breakfast is served from 8 - 10am, with cereals, fruit, rolls, yogurt, hardboiled eggs, juice, milk, coffee and tea -- something for everyone. We timed our visit for possibly the hottest weather in history -- daytime temps of 110 degrees -- but in cooler weather, there is a sweet little outdoor fireplace in the breakfast area. Fortunately, the temperatures would abate overnight so that al fresco dining in the morning was very pleasant. We were able to book the suite, which is two bedrooms -- a main bedroom area with a King bed that includes a small dining table, tv, sink and fridge, along with a smaller bedroom with a Queen bed, and a spacious bathroom. Four women stayed comfortably here. Our room was at the end of one of the building units, next door to the day spa, and backs up to the fenced-in pool area, so we had complete privacy. It almost felt more like our own little cottage. We had booked one-hour massages at the adjacent spa, and they were able to handle all four of us simultaneously. Robes were provided in the room, so we just walked next door in our robes for our appointment. (The spa is under new management, and one of the two new owners -- previously of Auberge du Soleil -- greeted us and made us feel very welcome.) This is not a luxury spa, but is clean, bright, nicely staffed, and met our needs. The EuroSpa is two short blocks off of Lincoln, the main road through Calistoga for shopping and dining. It's very walkable, but if you must drive, there is ample parking in the downtown area. The hotel manager, Bill, is helpful, warm and funny. In addition to helping me re-book our reservations after unexpectedly having to postpone our trip in April, he suggested the suite arrangement for the four of us as well as a spa package that included the one-hour masages. All told, we each paid approximately $200 for two nights lodging AND the massage (plus breakfast each morning). He immediately fixed an airconditioning 'problem' (pilot error on our part), gave us coupons for some of the Napa wineries, tips on where to eat, and made a dinner reservation for us. Thanks, Bill. While time didn't allow us to explore north of Calistoga, we did visit several wineries south of there, including Cakebread (delightful in all ways), Ehlers (charming), Rutherford (nice, but would only go if you're visiting Auberge du Soleil), Mondavi (A+ for the scenery but the unfriendly gentleman overseeing our tasting experience Sunday morning was a bummer) and V. Sattui (super crowded, almost frenzied feel to the place on the Sunday we stopped by), plus visits to Auberge du Soleil for lunch (beautiful, expensive food, incredible service and gorgeous views) and the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone for shopping (just the Greystone building alone is worth a stop). Would highly recommend EuroSpa & Inn to wine country visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nola99
Reviews.Content: Before heading to stay in the Napa Valley area, I did A LOT of research. I probably looked at every hotel's website and tracked down as many reviews as possible. With 3 people in the party, it made it a little difficult to find a place that was reasonable & could accomodate an extra person comfortably. We finally settled on the Eurospa Inn & went with one of their larger rooms. The hotel is a block off the main Calistoga strip and is set up with cottages in a horseshoe shape around the parking lot. Our room had a king-sized bed in the living room and a small extra bedroom with a queen-sized bed. The bathroom had both a shower and a big jacuzzi bath tub. It had a cable tv, a small fridge and a small fireplace, along with a little table & chairs. The complimentary robes & pool towels they provided were also great. They serve complimentary continental breakfast al fresco in the morning- which was a nice touch. The highlight of the trip was winding down after a day of visiting wineries by relaxing by the hot tub with a bottle of champagne, cheese & bread. If you're expecting the Ritz, then you might be disappointed. But if you want a nice quiet place to crash at the end of the day, then the Eurospa will be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're looking to save $$”
Reviews.Author: oolah
Reviews.Content: Like the last few reviewers, I was also surprised by the "motel-ness" of this location, since the web site describes it as "deluxe accomodations." Well, deluxe it's not. The room we had was dark and stuffy, and the bed stiff and creaky. The view out the window was of our car in the parking lot. The owners were very nice, helpful people, and the place was clean and well-maintained. If that's all you need, and you're looking to save a little money, this place is for you. If you're looking for atmosphere, luxury, or any frills, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Napa area!”
Reviews.Author: lani721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 nights at the Eurospa in Calistoga this past Memorial weekend. Although it is not a high-end hotel, it is definitely a good value for the Napa Valley area! Considering that the average hotel and B & B prices for that area during the holidays are between $250 - $300, Eurospa is a good choice for $250 a night (queen-size bed, 2-person jacuzzi, fireplace, huge bathroom) which also included a 1-hour massage for both my husband and I. The hotel also serves continental breakfast that included fresh fruit, yogurt, oj, coffee, milk, cereal and pastries. It has a small pool with a hot tub which is great for relaxing after a full day's wine tasting! The staff members are really nice espcially Bill at the front desk (manager and owner I think). But most of all, the hotel is very clean. Please be advised that this is more of a motel than a hotel, but this is a very common thing in Calistoga. I highly recommend this place for those of you wanting to stay in the Napa area who would rather spend your money in wine purchases (we bought tons!!!) and go to high-end restaurants such as the Auberge du Soleil (Rutherford) and Martini House (St. Helena)! Hope this review will help make your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at all of the good ratings...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at all of the good ratings! My wife and I went for a weekend getaway and read many glowing reviews of EuroSpa, so we booked two nights (the minimum for weekends) and massages for each of us. We were definitely let down. The biggest drawback is that the place looks like a Motel 6. I should have known better as all of the photos on their website are beautiful stock photos of the hills of Calistoga. When one thinks of "EuroSpa" (whatever that might me!) Motel 6 does not come to mind. All of the rooms (of which there are maybe 10 or so) face the middle parking lot. None of them even have windows facing the hills or anything other than a big slab of pavement and cars. The spa was nothing to write home about. The pool was extremely uninviting. The room was dark, with pretty bad lighting. However, that being said, the people were very nice. My massage was great (my wife's was pretty bad, apparently). The rooms have a tiny "fireplace" which was sort of pointless. The bathrooms were pretty nice, with big bath tubs. The bed was comfortable. I think if their website actually showed photos of the place and it were a bit more reasonable, I would have known what I was getting into and not have been as disappointed. I would never go back here......

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, understated and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZoomLady
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a bed and breakfast with over-the-top fufu and frills, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a comfortable, quiet, understated property that is close to downtown shopping and restaurants, has a good quality spa onsite and a heated pool, you'll like it here. Two lady friends travelling together for a spa weekend, we booked a spa package weekend in room #14 (two comfortable queen beds). It was very reasonably priced for the area. The place is in a neighborhood setting and backs up to vineyards. While it has a bit of a mini-motel court feel, everything is freshly painted, decked and clean. There's an outdoor breakfast and socializing area that boasts a wood stove for chilly mornings where a nice continental breakfast is served. This area is also a hub for afternoon "snacks" (cookies, savory snacks and sparkling cider). While our double room really had no view, it was very large with a wood burning stove, an entryway sitting alcove, TV, wetbar and a big bathroom with shower and a luxury whirlpool bathtub that could truly accommodate two full grown adults. Complimentary bathrobes and pool towels were nice to have for the pool and spa treatments. The heated pool and whirlpool spa overlooks the vineyards at the back of the property. Our spa treatments on the second day of our stay were quite good. We each had relaxation massages and facials by skilled employees. I was very impressed that my wishes were carried out with the utmost concern for my enjoyment and relaxation. While the spa is no marble-floored extravaganza, I was quite at home in their treatment rooms, although the lighting could have been a bit dimmer for my taste. I would gladly return for future treatments. I would highly recommend EuroSpa & Inn to anyone who wants to visit wine country, have a pleasant experience and not have to take out a loan. We were not all that impressed with the local restaurants, but we also did not try the most expensive offerings. The best place we ate was lunch at Pacifico (Mexican). We tried Boskos (not too impressive -- the salad was drenched in nasty dressing and the service mediocre) and the local pizza joint (pizza was virtually tasteless, but the salads good).

Reviews.Title: “People were nice - place was a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in another hotel - but had spa appointments at the EuroSpa - wow. It was a total dump - although everyone was sweet - it looks like a Motel 6. When we pulled up we almost didn't get out of the car. We made the best of our experience - and now my girlfriends and I have a good funny story to tell about that place. I think there is a reason you cannot find picutures on the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Eurospa Inn”
Reviews.Author: gulllible1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to spend our spring break in Napa Valley, and after doing some research decide to book a room at the EuroSpa Inn. Although the weather left much to be desired, we were very satisfied with the inn (which really is an inn in every way: quaint, cozy, and friendly proprieters). Our room featured a large sleigh bed, a tv with cable, microwave, minifridge, and of course some glasses and a corkscrew. The bathroom was also nicely stocked, and featured a small jacuzzi tub. Located just two short blocks from Highway 29, the inn is within walking distance to "downtown" Calistoga and the various restaurants there. But a very nice aspect of the inn is the continental breakfast served every morning with a few copies of the Chronicle. Fresh fruit, yougurt, cereal, and breakfast pastries can be enjoyed right by the outdoor fireplace. In the afternoon, a light snack is served as well, although we were never back in time to experience it ourselves. Overall, the EuroSpa Inn's rates were a great value for Napa Valley accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Euro Inn and Spa with 3 other couples and kids. Having kids now has changed our "napa getaways" slightly, so we wanted a nice place, but didn't want to worry about the kids being a problem for others. This place was so welcoming and CLEAN. It is difficult to stay in Napa Valley these days for under $200, and this place was such a great value for what you get. It isn't 4 star, but you aren't paying $500 either. The location makes it walkable to all the restaurants in downtown Calistoga, with decent rooms and all the ammenities. Someone's review mentioned the size of the rooms being small, but we did not find that to be the case. I don't know what room they stayed in, but none of our rooms were small. We have high standards and expensive taste, and the Euro Inn and Spa provided what we needed at a great price so we could spend more money on the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every year I take my boyfriend away for a surprise birthday weekend getaway. Since his birthday happens to fall a few days before Valentine's, this is also a romantic trip for both of us. This year I was looking for a romantic package that also featured the spa specialities Calistoga has to offer. Since I am a poor graduate student, it was hard to find a hotel that offerred everything I wanted but at a good price. I lucked out when I found the Eurospa Inn! I booked the "Romantic Getaway Package" and was able to get 2 nights stay, 2 1-hour massages, dinner for two, champagne, and a room with a king bed, fireplace, and whirlpool tub! I was a little worried when I read reviews calling the Eurospa a "motel", however I was pleasantly surprised to open the door to my room (#5) and find a very clean, quaint room with bathrobes and chilled champagne waiting for us. The small fireplace quickly warmed up our room and although the whirlpool tub was for 1, we were able to both enjoy a romantic bath. The location was off the main highway and very quiet all nights of my stay. In the morning we enjoyed a breakfast of fruit, yogurt, muffins, and juice by the fire and in the afternoon cookies and Martinelli's were available. Because the weather was so great, we were also able to take a dip in the pool and spa during the afternoon. The spa and pool were clean and it was very relaxing to sit in the spa while watching the sun set by the vineyard next door to Eurospa. We chose to use our dinner gift certificate to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday dinner at Brannan's Grill (great food and atmosphere). It was a very short walk to the downtown from the hotel, which made our time more relaxing as everything we needed was conveniently located. The manager at Eurospa was very helpful in making our reservations and also recommending restaurants for the other night's of our stay. With the money I saved, I was able to spend my money on mudbaths, winetasting, and another night's stay. Overall, I highly recommend the Eurospa. This is a special find where the small details really show how much thought the owners and managers have put into making one's visit special at an affordable rate. I will certainly return again for a quaint and comfortable stay! I will try to post pictures soon if I can figure out how to use my camera!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EuroSpa & Inn upon recommendation from the management at the Sonoma Creek Inn. It was a delightful, but small room. It featured an “electric” gas burning stove, which kept the room quite toasty. We had a double Jacuzzi tub in our room along with a stall shower. The bathroom was very large, plenty of room for dressing. It did lack a place to store your own toiletries and cosmetics. The king size bed took up most of the space in the room. The room also had a nice, quiet refrigerator, microwave, and a coffee pot that was equipped to grind whole beans that were provided. Bill and Joanne, managers, were very accommodating. We enjoyed the open patio area that was designated for the abundant continental breakfast, that consisted of hard boiled eggs, granola, cereal, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, breads, muffins or Danish, freshly prepared fruit and yogurt. There was also a manager’s welcome of apple cider and cookies. I also took advantage of the “Day Spa” that is offered. Ashley and Deborah were very helpful with the appointment and Deborah gave a fantastic massage. Prices are well within the “norm” for the spa treatments. An absolute must after a day of driving and wine tasting. Things we liked: * Fireplace * Breakfast on outdoor patio with the fireplace lit * Spa treatments * Ability to make your own coffee with freshly ground beans * Easy parking * Downtown area is within walking distance * Great Italian restaurant in town, Boskos, everything served was fresh and homemade including the pastas * Within a 10 mile driving distance of majority of wineries and Dean & Deluca Purveyor of Fine Food and Wine (a must for great, made to order deli sandwiches) Things we didn’t like: * Storm drain pump came on during a rain early in the morning * Lattice fence around the pool area was in need of major repair * Neighbors in house adjacent to Inn smoked and it came into room * Wooden stairs and patio were slippery when wet * Room was extremely dark, could have used some sort of a night light * Limited space for luggage * No table space for eating in room * No table space or shelf in bathroom for toiletries * Jacuzzi tub in room was difficult to enter and exit safely and easily

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Calistoga for the purpose of getting married. My accommodation requirements were unique as I was traveling with a party of five. Eurospa easily met my lodging needs. We stayed in a room with two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. While some of the reviews posted state the rooms are small, we had plenty of space. The second night which was the wedding night, we had two rooms. Again the size of the room was not an issue. Both rooms had oversized jacuzzi tubs; perfect for two adults. I also want to emphasize this property is extremely clean! The property itself is very quiet and quaint. There is a small day spa on site. There is also a small pool and hottub. This recreational area is behind the property and backs up to an open field/winery. The staff is very attentative and extremely nice. The prices are fair and reasonable. I have worked in the travel industry for multiple years and travel frequently. Eurospa and Inn is the perfect place to relax, unwind and enjoy Calistoga and the wine country.

HotelInfo.Name: EuroSpa & Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1202 Pine St., Calistoga, CA 94515
